title: NLP ‚Äî Classification CamemBERT + XGBoost/Random Forest
text:
Probl√®me
Classer des libell√©s/textes courts issus d‚Äôapplications m√©tier publiques (qualit√© variable, orthographe bruit√©e).


Approche

Encodage CamemBERT (sentence-level embeddings), agr√©gation moyenne.
Classifieurs tabulaires (XGBoost / Random Forest) vs couche softmax fine-tun√©e (ablation).
Nettoyage minimal, robustesse √† l‚Äôorthographe, calibration des probabilit√©s (Platt).



R√©sultats

Temps d‚Äôinf√©rence < 15 ms / texte (batch GPU ‚Üí CPU quantis√©).



Stack & Code (extrait en R)
library(reticulate)
transformers <- import("transformers")
torch <- import("torch")

tok <- transformers$AutoTokenizer$from_pretrained("camembert-base")
model <- transformers$AutoModel$from_pretrained("camembert-base")

encode_texts <- function(texts) {
  enc <- tok(texts, padding=TRUE, truncation=TRUE, return_tensors="pt")
  with_no_grad <- torch$no_grad()
  with_no_grad$__enter__()
  out <- model(**enc)
  emb <- as.array(torch$mean(out$last_hidden_state, dim=1)$cpu()$numpy())
  with_no_grad$__exit__(NULL, NULL, NULL)
  emb
}
